title: Speech Translation:SEKAI PHONE
developerAddress: 97220 OR Portland, 8520 NE Alderwood Rd Suite D #75738
description: Realtime Speech Translation. It was showcased on Japanese TV programs.- Supporting 16 Languages such as English, Japanese, French, German and etc.- If you call phone to another with this app, you speak your own lang (e.g.Japanese), your voice changing to receiver's own lang (e.g.English).- New Feature "Bookmark": Registering and Viewing your favorite sentences.- Fixed Android 4.x Crash problems at opening settings.- Compatible with Smartphone, Table, Android Wear, Chromecast and SmartEyeglass.- AI Feature (e.g. "Please change to French" -> Translation will be changed to French.).Here are 4 modes.(1)Talk ModeThis mode is intended for translating on the spot. (2)Phone ModeThis mode is intended for translating over telephone calls. (3)HandFree ModeThis mode is intended for translating without watching Smartphone Screens. (4)Camera ModeIf you take pictures, the characters will be automatically translating. Also it supports Android Wear, Chromecast, SmartEyeglass and etc.*NoticeIf you have installed older version and failed to update app, please try uninstall older app and install new one.*Support Language-Japanese-English-German-French-Italian-Spanish-Chinese-Portuguese-Dutch-Greek-Norwegian-Swedish-Finnish-Russian-Korean-Thai*Caution-Requires Internet.-To use on Android 4.3 + device, you can also speech text on paticular language. But you need to install other speech application (paid app). We appreciate your understanding.-To use collaboration with SmartEyeglass, you can also speech text on paticular language. But you need to install other speech application (paid app). We appreciate your understanding.*OtherDroidcon Stockholm 2014, Madrid 2014, Amsterdam 2013, Paris 2013, London 2012, Google Developer Day 2011 DemonstrationMulti-Screen UX Competition 2013 Excellence AwardsAndroid Developer Lab 2011 5th prize (Google Tblet App Contest)i*deal competition 2010 finalist*Bloghttp://blog.iplatform.org/
descriptionHTML:
Realtime Speech Translation. It was showcased on Japanese TV programs.
- Supporting 16 Languages such as English, Japanese, French, German and etc.
- If you call phone to another with this app, you speak your own lang (e.g.Japanese), your voice changing to receiver's own lang (e.g.English).
- New Feature "Bookmark": Registering and Viewing your favorite sentences.
- Fixed Android 4.x Crash problems at opening settings.
- Compatible with Smartphone, Table, Android Wear, Chromecast and SmartEyeglass.
- AI Feature (e.g. "Please change to French" -> Translation will be changed to French.).

Here are 4 modes.

(1)Talk Mode
This mode is intended for translating on the spot.

(2)Phone Mode
This mode is intended for translating over telephone calls.

(3)HandFree Mode
This mode is intended for translating without watching Smartphone Screens.

(4)Camera Mode
If you take pictures, the characters will be automatically translating.

Also it supports Android Wear, Chromecast, SmartEyeglass and etc.

*Notice
If you have installed older version and failed to update app, please try uninstall older app and install new one.

*Support Language
-Japanese
-English
-German
-French
-Italian
-Spanish
-Chinese
-Portuguese
-Dutch
-Greek
-Norwegian
-Swedish
-Finnish
-Russian
-Korean
-Thai

*Caution
-Requires Internet.
-To use on Android 4.3 + device, you can also speech text on paticular language. But you need to install other speech application (paid app). We appreciate your understanding.
-To use collaboration with SmartEyeglass, you can also speech text on paticular language. But you need to install other speech application (paid app). We appreciate your understanding.

*Other
Droidcon Stockholm 2014, Madrid 2014, Amsterdam 2013, Paris 2013, London 2012, Google Developer Day 2011 Demonstration
Multi-Screen UX Competition 2013 Excellence Awards
Android Developer Lab 2011 5th prize (Google Tblet App Contest)
i*deal competition 2010 finalist

*Blog
http://blog.iplatform.org/
comments: Helped us through some difficult moments in Japan and was fun for all to enjoy (not just us).
